intro: Psychotria albidocalyx var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded understories of rainforests. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
